result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas L Wieczorek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas L Wieczorek in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Read in list attached to the Complaint is read in at this time.

Court orders the following:
-60 days Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution in the amount of $189.90 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) to Roundys as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or school. 
- Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas L Wieczorek in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State provides discovery.  Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save store and no contact with the co-actor listed in the complaint.

Defendant Nicholas L Wieczorek in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
